instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck 5v
threads.message:
hello,
please need help for mainboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
i have 5V with power supplies, turn to 0.850A 1sec and turn again 0V
Check F5200/01 i have 12.5V
no liquid see on this
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck 5v
threads.message:
All USB-C ports have the exact symptom?
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL>.

Check for short on any secondary power supply.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck 5v
threads.message:
Yes on each usb c same problem
Same to magsafe 3
Check tomorrow for <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL>

You say check short on secondary power supply but wich line because on your file i see all line list in mainboard 
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck 5v
threads.message: You need to check only the power rails, not all the lines listed there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck 5v
threads.message:
Short detect on <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL>. I have inject with powerlab and i have see caps defect
All is working. Thanks Ã  lot
